oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Dug relics from Hartsville, Tennessee
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The Battle of Hartsville was fought between Union troops and Confederate troops commanded by General John Hunt Morgan in December 1862. Hartsville was ocuppied by both armies at different times during the war. This collection of relics include .69 rifle-musket bullets, .58 caliber minie bullets, Williams cleaner rounds, and various round balls. Also included are two coins. There is a friction buckle which is probably from the WWII Tennessee manuevers in 1943.
